meticulously_wild: Great blog post. The act of giving is more for the giver than it is for the recipient (I think). We should always give (with a humble heart, at that) because we want to express an internal love/care/feeling for another. I think the gift is kind of the byproduct of the FEELING. I believe most (not all, bc sometimes ppl just want shinny shit) gifts should be things that are needed; whether we gather that from observation or interrogation. And “needed” doesn’t need to be totally utilitarian; someone may need a beautifully written note or a date/trip/time. I love to give gifts, but I’ve had to learn to do so at a rate that would not deplete me financially or subject me, emotionally (as some ppl think that when you give once, it means that they expect you to give again and again). As for the necklace you are still holding onto, I think you should let it go if it illicits hurt and negative feelings. Although you have it hidden away in a box that you do not touch, in your mind, you know it’s there. Your thoughts about it may even grow and take up more space that the box that holds the necklace itself (slash I’m sure you could buy yourself one if you wanted, bc you a #bossbabe). If it doesn’t hurt you, I hope the necklace at least reminds you that once upon a time, that person felt something special for you BECAUSE you ARE special. Even if they don’t feel that way now, guess what? You’re STILL extraordinary. Thanks for sharing another piece of you. 💜
